{"step_by_step_thinking": "Family history is indeed a significant risk factor for high cholesterol levels, but it's not the only one. Other factors such as diet, physical activity, and obesity also play a role. Moreover, not all children with a family history of high cholesterol will develop it themselves, and some children without a family history may develop high cholesterol due to lifestyle factors. Therefore, relying solely on family history may miss some children who should be screened.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
